source.0ae664b7:
> Covid19 <- read.csv("Latest Covid-19 India Status.csv")
> head(Covid19)
source.e6c6cab4:
ggplot(data = Covid19)+
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = Active.Ratio....,y=Death.Ratio....,color = State.UTs)) + labs(title = "Active Ratio VS Death Ratio")
source.5d587bd1:
ggplot(data = Covid19)+
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = Active.Ratio....,y=Death.Ratio....,color = State.UTs)) + 
  labs(title = "Active Ratio VS Death Ratio") +
  annotate("text",x = 18.59,y=0.41,label="Mizoram")+annotate("text",x=0.05,y=2.8,label="Punjab")
source.b4896912:
#  **Exploration**
 
# # # 1. Relation between active ratios and death ratios in RStudio
source.ce6618bc: To know which is the state with highest active Ratio and which state has highest death ratio we can add labels.
